channel.title: Alexandru Prisacariu: The Website
channel.description: Place where Alexandru Prisacariu posts things

item.title: Applying retry pattern in Async Rust
item.description: Implementing robust retry system in async Rust with exponential backoff, full jitter, and transient error checks.

item.title: Creating a new version of alexprisacariu.dev
item.description: Time to upgrade my website to have light & dark theme, some more dynamic features and a better home page.

item.title: Creating a simple popup chatbot using OpenAI
item.description: Learn how to build a popup AI chatbot using OpenAI's ChatGPT, Whisper (STT), and TTS. Covers both a simple HTTP implementation and a real-time WebSocket version.

item.title: Creating an application for my wedding invitations - Launch
item.description: Part 2 of the wedding invitation app series. A deep dive into the Go backend architecture, Google Sheets integration, SolidJS frontend, and deployment on a VPS.

item.title: Always use Promise.all() (or any other Promise's method) for array of promises
item.description: Understand why using Promise.all(), Promise.allSettled(), or Promise.any() is crucial for handling arrays of promises in JavaScript to prevent crashes and improve performance.

item.title: Creating an application for my wedding invitations - Setup
item.description: Part 1 of creating a custom wedding invitation application. Discussing the choice of Go for backend, SolidJS for frontend, and Google Sheets for storage.

item.title: Creating a radio station on a Raspberry Pi using DarkIce and IceCast2
item.description: Create your own radio station using a Raspberry Pi 3. Step-by-step guide to configuring DarkIce and IceCast2 for live audio streaming on Ubuntu.

item.title: Dev Ideas #1: Handle data between tabs components
item.description: Explore efficient ways to share data between tab components in React. A comparison of lifting state up vs. using a parent class variable for data persistence.

item.title: OLD: How to create a screenshot system
item.description: Implement a screenshot system in your SFML game. This tutorial shows how to capture the window, save images with timestamps, and handle key presses.

item.title: OLD: How to create a simple button
item.description: A comprehensive guide to creating a reusable button class in SFML. Learn to handle mouse events, hover effects, and click actions in C++.

item.title: OLD: How to flip sprites
item.description: Learn how to flip sprites in SFML using C++. This tutorial covers two methods: modifying sprite scale and inverting texture rects for animation.

item.title: OLD: Jumping in 2D platform games
item.description: Learn how to implement smooth jumping mechanics in a 2D platform game using C++ and SFML. Covers gravity, ground detection, and jump physics.

item.title: OLD: How to apply collision
item.description: Master AABB collision detection and resolution in SFML. This tutorial explains how to handle collisions between dynamic and static objects in 2D games using C++.

item.title: OLD: Create a simple piano
item.description: Learn how to create a simple piano application using C++ and SFML. This tutorial covers sound handling, keyboard input, and visual feedback for a virtual piano.

item.title: OLD: Custom mouse cursor
item.description: A step-by-step tutorial on implementing a custom mouse cursor in SFML using C++. Learn to hide the default cursor and render a sprite at the mouse position.
